transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (hums the opening guitar riff from "Sweet Home Alabama" over and over and over and...)

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, this is Tansut, welcoming you to another edition of "Space Ghost Coast to Coast". Tonight, Space Ghost yuks it up with reggae roustabout Jimmy Cliff, and musician Jack Logan. Did I read that right? "Yuk"? What does that mean? Maybe I should just amend it right here. No? Oh, keep on going? And now, a grown man in leotards, and I think he feels pretty sassy about it, Spaaaace Ghoooost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Greetings, citizens! I'm Space Ghost! On my show tonight, I'll be probing (winks) a couple of top notch musicians to find out what makes them tick.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in to desk, his seat is much lower than normal) (That's strange; the desk seems much higher tonight. Unless...) Hey, who's been messing with my chair?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The seat is still warm! Zorak, were you sitting in my chair?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Listen, Zorak, the chair's still warm, so I know it had to be you or Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (operates pneumatic control, raising chair) Moltar, were you sitting in my chair?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Were you sitting in my chair?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm not talkin' about anything, I'm asking you if you were sitting here!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Mmmm, like a time bomb tick?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, more like my Mickey Mouse watch. A nice tick!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Time bombs are nice. Tick tick tick... Boom! Tick tick tick... Boom!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You know, there's also an insect called a tick. It's small, but can cause a very grave illness.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It's actually a parasite, which, uh, means it receives nourishment from its host...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (interrupting) Yes, thank you Moltar. Anyway, on tonight's program, singer / songwriter / swimming pool motor repairman Jack Logan is here. Along with bongo man / something else probably, reggae legend Jimmy Cliff. Now, that's a lot of s's. S... s... Moltar, I think there's something wrong with my sibilance. Ssssibilance... Sssibilance... Ssssssssssssibilance.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I'm so tired. I haven't slept a wink.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, reggae legend Jimmy Cliff. Welcome to my show, o Bongo Man.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're welcome. So, what do you think of the big show? Pretty fancy, eh?

transcript.speaker: Jimmy Cliff
transcript.dialogue: So far, so good. Still enjoying myself.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) I see. Now Jimmy, my belly is full, but I'm hungry.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And a hungry mon is an angry mon.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So James, tell me everything you've been doing lately.

transcript.speaker: Jimmy Cliff
transcript.dialogue: ... and I've been doing a few shows...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I love South America! Y'know, Jimmy, that's the land of the great Delta Blues men. You know, Muddy Rivers, Crew Cut Johnson, Blind Orange Julius. All the great blues men are from South America.

transcript.speaker: Jimmy Cliff
transcript.dialogue: (pause) My new album is called "Higher and Higher".

transcript.speaker: Jimmy Cliff
transcript.dialogue: It's a mixture of some of my...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (interrupts) Carryin' me home to my kin? Singing songs about the South land... I miss Alabamy once again. Turn it up!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Jimmy, can I ask you something?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's a question, is that okay?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Irie, yes. Do you think I'm irie.

transcript.speaker: Jimmy Cliff
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) You're very well on your way, yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is that good? I don't actually know what 'irie' means. All I know is that it has something to do with St. Patrick's Day, in that I'm supposed to wear my green cape that day.

transcript.speaker: Jimmy Cliff
transcript.dialogue: Irie... is to rule... one's internal.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm in touch with the beat of the Caribbean.

transcript.speaker: Jimmy Cliff
transcript.dialogue: So irie means "I rule, I internally".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Zorak, guess what? I'm irie.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares at Zorak) How about Zorak, Jimmy? I figure with that green shell, he's gotta have some irie blood in him.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Forward and Fiaca, menacle and den gosaca.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (talking to Jack on control room monitor) Well, let's see; my calculator collection; my autographed copy of "The Celestine Prophecy"; a sleeve or two of Oreos, and a box of Kleenex.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well, how about you? What do you keep underneath your bed?

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: Uh, magazines wrapped in plastic, of dead people.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: That's awesome! Dead people crack me up! Hey, Jack, you know what?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) Sometimes I like to wrap myself up in plastic.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: My next guess sings songs about motors and sprockets, and we couldn't be happier to have him here. Identify yourself, please.

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: (lowering on studio monitor) Jack Logan, uh, motor repairman, singer.

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: Great to be here, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let me begin with a serious question, Jackie boy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How about this pantsuit I'm sporting? Rather smart looking, is it not?

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: Is that the same one, or do you have like a big closet full of 'em, or... how does that work?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I have several, and I rotate.

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) I though so, I, you know, I didn't know if there was some special material that deflects dirt...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, but it is. It's a space-age material called spandex.

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Okay. And, the shape of your head is amazing.

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: I could see why, it's very, it's intimidating, but very attractive.

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, yeah, very strong, you know, I've got, like, clay, you know, it just looks like, you know, very weak chin. I saw it, I'm a little jealous.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You like my cut, do you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes, I'm cut like a rock.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Dense, like a loaf of turkey roll.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Pay no attention to him, Jack. He's evil.

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Well, he's kinda here against his will, right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes he is. He and Moltar were very bad, and I locked them up. Have you met Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I've, I've seen him. (laughs) He's very quiet, isn't he?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But enough about them. We were talking about my chin.

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: Do you have a ray that can tighten up my chin, and take some off the nose...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Silly citizen, rays are for superheroes!

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: Okay, well, yeah, have me back on the show when you get...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Silly citizen, raysss... raysss... are for superheroesss sss sss... Hey Moltar, nice work on the sibilance, buddy. I don't know what you did, but it's much better.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I turned the, uh... thing.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, Jack-a-roo, let's take a few seconds to talk about your new album. Are you ready? (':00.0' appears at bottom of screen) Begin.

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: (time starts counting up, with clock ticking sound) Uh, that's our latest record, it's been out for about five or six months...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (interrupts) Hey, Jack Logan, look what I can do! (blasts Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I, I think he is. And the little guy too, or is he dead now?

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Well, I shouldn't have brought that up, I'm sorry.

transcript.speaker: Raymond
transcript.dialogue: (muffled voice, from within Zorak) Somebody save me! I'm still alive! Somebody save me!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (talking over Raymond's yelling) Oh, uh, la la la la, la la la, nobody can hear, la la la la la...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh-kay, Jack Logan. Now, do I understand correctly that in addition to being a musician, you're also a mechanic?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Have you ever worked on a Phantom Cruiser?

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: No, no, I'd be interested to take a crack at one.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, been havin' some trouble with the helix compressor. I think there may be a short in the binomal oxidation tank, but I can't seem to get around the nancor valve.

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: Oh, okay, okay, yeah. I think you can bypass that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bypass the nancor valve? How are we gonna bypass the nancor valve?

transcript.speaker: Jack Logan
transcript.dialogue: It's, it's illegal, but... you know, you can get away with it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Excuse me, son, why would I want to "get away with" something that is illegal?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (starts blinking his left eye) Uh oh. Hold on, hold on, hold on, hold on, hold on. I've got something in my eye. Stop the show.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's goin' on with you, Moltar? What, you hit your head or somethin'?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I was, uh, out dancing last night. (pause) Dancing.
